node.title: Excited passengers prepare to board flights from London to the U.S.
node.alt: A flight to New York at Heathrow Airport, near London, on Monday.
node.description: Long lines formed in Heathrow Airport for the first scheduled trips to the United States since the Biden administration lifted its travel ban.
node.content: ["Thousands of excited passengers flocked into Heathrow Airport on Monday for the first flights to the United States out of London since the Biden Administration lifted a travel ban on international visitors.", "They were welcomed by dozens of airline staff who beamed and waved American flags as they ushered guests toward designated areas for documentation and security checks.", "As of Monday, foreign travelers can enter the United States if they can show proof of full vaccination and a negative Covid-19 test taken within three days of departure. Unvaccinated Americans and children under the age of 18 are exempt from the requirement, but they must take a test within one day of travel.", "\u201cNew York, baby, here we come,\u201d shouted one passenger as he high-fived a Virgin Atlantic staff member who was dressed as Elvis Presley. \u201cGod bless America,\u201d yelled another.", "Long lines quickly formed at check-in counters as passengers fumbled through their phones and printed-out documents, preparing their required paperwork.", "\u201cGoodness, I feel so nervous,\u201d said Bernadette Sumners, 56, from Stratford-on-Avon, England, who was taking her first flight since the start of the pandemic to visit her daughter in Oregon and her son in New York.", "\u201cThere so many things to remember and organize,\u201d she said as she sat on a bench in the departure terminal, refreshing her email feed every few minutes as she waited for her negative Covid-19 test result. \u201cIt\u2019s very stressful, but I know it\u2019s going to be worth it when I see my children and meet my grandchildren,\u201d she said, her eyes welling up with tears.", "Others were surprised by how organized and quick the process was. \u201cI came four hours early to give myself a good margin for error, but the whole process is super easy and efficient,\u201d said Noah Cunningham, a 46-year-old screenwriter from London, who was traveling to New York for work.", "\u201cWhen governments impose these travel restrictions they act as if people just travel for leisure, but this ban has been a killer for business,\u201d he said. \u201cI didn\u2019t want to lose a day. As soon as the lifting of the ban was announced I booked my ticket.\u201d", "A group of three women waited in line to check into their New York flight with stacks of luggage emblazoned with American flags. \u201cMost of these bags are empty,\u201d said Julia Jacobs, a 39-year-old real estate agent. \u201cWe\u2019re off to the Big Apple for some Christmas shopping and Christmas cheer. It\u2019s been such a depressing two years, we need to see those bright lights and do some retail therapy.\u201d"]
